intro: Erythrospermum monticola var. amplifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved erythrospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are broader than those of the typical variety, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
